events.title: United States Constitution Ratified
events.description: New Hampshire became the ninth state to ratify the United States Constitution, enabling it to become effective and establishing the foundation for the new American government.
events.significance: This ratification marked the official establishment of the Constitution as the supreme law of the United States, shaping the nation's government and legal system.

events.title: Start of the Berlin Airlift
events.description: The Soviet Union blockaded West Berlin, leading the Western Allies to respond by airlifting supplies to the city's residents to circumvent the blockade.
events.significance: The Berlin Airlift was a significant early confrontation of the Cold War, demonstrating Western commitment to Berlin and opposition to Soviet expansion.

events.title: Tylenol Murders Begin
events.description: The first deaths in the notorious Tylenol poisonings occurred in the Chicago area, with victims dying after ingesting cyanide-laced capsules.
events.significance: These events led to major changes in packaging and regulations in the pharmaceutical industry to enhance product safety and restore public confidence.

events.title: First Live Global HDTV Broadcast
events.description: The first live global high-definition television broadcast took place, showcasing advancements in broadcasting technology and connectivity.
events.significance: This milestone marked a significant leap in global communication technology, influencing future media distribution and quality standards.
